@/components/ui/button @/components/ui/input @/components/ui/accordion Frequently Asked Questions Find answers to common questions about pensions, claims, and more. How do I claim my Tier 2 benefits? To claim your Tier 2 benefits, download and complete the Tier 2 Benefit Claim Form from our Self-Service Centre. Submit the form along with required documents including proof of retirement age and employment history. When will I receive my benefit after retirement? Once your claim is approved, benefits are typically processed within 10-15 working days. Payment will be made directly to your registered bank account. Can I contribute to both Tier 2 and Tier 3? Yes, you can contribute to both Tier 2 and Tier 3 schemes simultaneously. Tier 2 is mandatory through your employer, while Tier 3 offers additional voluntary contributions. Who qualifies for the Account Booster program? The Account Booster program is available to all Tier 3 contributors who maintain regular monthly contributions for at least 6 months. How do I check my pension balance online? Log in to the Member Portal using your PAN and password. Your current balance and contribution history will be displayed on your dashboard. How do I update my personal details? You can update your personal information through the Member Portal or by submitting a change request form at our office.
@/components/ui/button Enroll in a Pension Plan Secure your future in just a few steps. Learn how to enroll in our pension schemes as an individual or employer.

Best Pensions Master Trust Scheme A mandatory Tier 2 scheme providing 5% contribution of basic salary for retirement security. /schemes/master-trust from-primary/20 via-transparent to-accent/20 Best Personal Pensions Scheme A flexible Tier 3 long-term investment scheme with tax benefits for enhanced pension. /schemes/personal-pension from-accent/20 via-transparent to-primary/20 DOSH Personal Pensions Scheme The Combo - A specialized personal pension scheme combining traditional benefits with modern flexibility. /schemes/dosh-pension from-primary/20 via-accent/20 to-transparent Best Provident Fund Scheme A fully funded and privately managed Tier 3 provident fund scheme with tax benefits. /schemes/provident-fund from-accent/20 via-primary/20 to-transparent Employer Sponsored Schemes Comprehensive trustee services for 2nd & 3rd Tier pensions with full establishment ownership. /schemes/employer-sponsored from-primary/20 to-accent/20

@/components/ui/button Provident Fund Scheme (Tier 3) | Standard Pensions Trust Learn about the Provident Fund Scheme (Tier 3) offered by Standard Pensions Trust. s National Pensions Act, 2008 (Act 766). It serves as a supplementary retirement savings plan, allowing both employers and employees in the formal sector to contribute additional funds beyond the mandatory Tier 1 and Tier 2 schemes. The scheme is administered by licensed corporate trustees, such as Standard Pensions Trust, and is designed to enhance retirement benefits and provide financial flexibility. {/* Contribution Limits & Tax Benefits */} Contribution Limits & Tax Benefits {/* Card 1: Tax Reliefs */} Tax Reliefs Contributions up to 16.5% of an employee
@/components/ui/button Personal Pension Scheme (Tier 3) | Standard Pensions Trust Learn about the Personal Pension Scheme (Tier 3) offered by Standard Pensions Trust.

@/components/ui/button Tier 2 – Master Trust Pension | Standard Pensions Trust Learn about the Tier 2 Master Trust Pension scheme offered by Standard Pensions Trust. s 2008 Pension Act—part of a three-tier system aimed at enhancing retirement security. It targets formal-sector employees, requiring contributions from both employee and employer, and is administered by licensed commercial trustees, such as Standard Pensions Trust. {/* Contribution Structure */} Contribution Structure 5% of your basic salary is deducted monthly and allocated to Tier 2. This is in addition to your employer re automatically enrolled by your employer if they

@/components/ui/button Employer Sponsored Pension Schemes | Standard Pensions Trust Learn about the Employer Sponsored Pension Schemes offered by Standard Pensions Trust. s basic salary, with the option for additional voluntary contributions. {/* Item 2: Tier 3 Contributions */} Tier 3 Contributions: Employers and employees can contribute a combined total of up to 16.5% of the employee s basic salary are tax-deductible, providing significant tax savings for both employers and employees. {/* Benefit 3: Financial Security for Employees */} Financial Security for Employees Employees benefit from structured retirement savings, ensuring financial stability in their post-employment years. {/* Benefit 4: Regulatory Compliance */} Regulatory Compliance Employers ensure adherence to the National Pensions Act, mitigating legal risks and penalties. {/* Benefit 5: Customizable Plans */} Customizable Plans Schemes can be tailored to meet the unique needs of the organization and its workforce. {/* Empty cell to complete the 2x3 grid */} {/* Scheme Overview Table */} Scheme Overview Feature Details Contribution Rates Employer and employee contributions as agreed upon; Tier 2: 5% (employee), Tier 3: Up to 16.5% (voluntary) Tax Reliefs Contributions up to 16.5% of basic salary are tax-deductible Withdrawal Conditions Tax-free withdrawals after 10 years for formal sector employees; early withdrawals permitted under specific conditions Loan Facilities Access to secured loans at competitive interest rates using accumulated funds as collateral Professional Management Managed by NPRA-licensed trustees and fund managers Digital Services Online portals and mobile access for account management Portability Funds are transferable when changing employment {/* Call to Action */} Ready to discuss an Employer Sponsored Scheme for your organization? Contact us today to learn more about how we can tailor a pension solution to meet your company

@/components/ui/button Careers | Standard Pensions Trust Explore career opportunities and join the Standard Pensions Trust team. Senior Frontend Developer We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Frontend Developer to lead the development of our user-facing applications. You will be responsible for implementing visual and interactive elements that users interact with through their web browser. Pension Administrator Join our operations team as a Pension Administrator. You will be responsible for managing client accounts, processing contributions, and handling pension benefit claims. We are seeking an Investment Analyst to support our investment team. You will be involved in market research, financial modeling, and portfolio performance analysis. Customer Service Representative A dynamic individual to join our Customer Service team. You will be the first point of contact for our members, providing information and resolving inquiries. t Find Your Role? Submit a general application, and we

@/components/ui/button @/components/ui/input @/components/ui/accordion Frequently Asked Questions Find answers to common questions about pensions, claims, and more. How do I claim my Tier 2 benefits? To claim your Tier 2 benefits, download and complete the Tier 2 Benefit Claim Form from our Self-Service Centre. Submit the form along with required documents including proof of retirement age and employment history. When will I receive my benefit after retirement? Once your claim is approved, benefits are typically processed within 10-15 working days. Payment will be made directly to your registered bank account. Can I contribute to both Tier 2 and Tier 3? Yes, you can contribute to both Tier 2 and Tier 3 schemes simultaneously. Tier 2 is mandatory through your employer, while Tier 3 offers additional voluntary contributions. Who qualifies for the Account Booster program? The Account Booster program is available to all Tier 3 contributors who maintain regular monthly contributions for at least 6 months. How do I check my pension balance online? Log in to the Member Portal using your PAN and password. Your current balance and contribution history will be displayed on your dashboard. How do I update my personal details? You can update your personal information through the Member Portal or by submitting a change request form at our office.

@/components/ui/button Careers | Standard Pensions Trust Explore career opportunities and join the Standard Pensions Trust team. Senior Frontend Developer We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Frontend Developer to lead the development of our user-facing applications. You will be responsible for implementing visual and interactive elements that users interact with through their web browser. Pension Administrator Join our operations team as a Pension Administrator. You will be responsible for managing client accounts, processing contributions, and handling pension benefit claims. We are seeking an Investment Analyst to support our investment team. You will be involved in market research, financial modeling, and portfolio performance analysis. Customer Service Representative A dynamic individual to join our Customer Service team. You will be the first point of contact for our members, providing information and resolving inquiries. t Find Your Role? Submit a general application, and we
